answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.IBS can produce a feeling of incomplete defecation. Then again please check for Diabetes as this can affect the sympathetic and parasympathetic nerves leading to bowel symptoms. This can be detected by a simple blood test. Also local pathologies in the rectum like growths or inflammatory diseases can also leave a feeling to defecation. For this a proctoscopy or a sigmoidoscopy will help detect the lesion. So, would advise you to discuss these options with your doctor when you happen to meet him next time.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: Hi, i am 68 & believed to have Fibromyalgia. I have lots of issues with bowels,like IBS.Had a good bowel movement 3 days ago. Then yesterday i felt like i needed to go but nothing but a little bit. no luck today either. could the suppitories i used 3 days ago have cleaned me out pretty good? I found out IBs goes with Fibromyalgia.Thanks,Patti
title: constipated
